verses.verse: Then Job <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H853><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
I know <S%H3045><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> thou canst do <S%H3201><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> thing, and that no <S%H3808><s%> thought <S%H4209><s%> can be withheld <S%H1219><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thee.

Who <S%H4310><s%> is he <S%H2088><s%> that hideth <S%H5956><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> knowledge? <S%H1847><s%> therefore <S%H3651><s%> have I uttered <S%H5046><s%> that I understood <S%H995><s%> not; <S%H3808><s%> things too wonderful <S%H6381><s%> for <S%H4480><s%> me, which I knew <S%H3045><s%> not. <S%H3808><s%>
Hear, <S%H8085><s%> I beseech thee, <S%H4994><s%> and I <S%H595><s%> will speak: <S%H1696><s%> I will demand <S%H7592><s%> of thee, and declare <S%H3045><s%> thou unto me.
I have heard <S%H8085><s%> of thee by the hearing <S%H8088><s%> of the ear: <S%H241><s%> but now <S%H6258><s%> mine eye <S%H5869><s%> seeth <S%H7200><s%> thee.
Wherefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> I abhor <S%H3988><s%> myself, and repent <S%H5162><s%> in <S%H5921><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> and ashes. <S%H665><s%>

And it was <S%H1961><s%> so, that after <S%H310><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had spoken <S%H1696><s%> <S%H853><s%> these <S%H428><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> Job, <S%H347><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to <S%H413><s%> Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite, <S%H8489><s%> My wrath <S%H639><s%> is kindled <S%H2734><s%> against thee, and against thy two <S%H8147><s%> friends: <S%H7453><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> ye have not <S%H3808><s%> spoken <S%H1696><s%> of <S%H413><s%> me the thing that is right, <S%H3559><s%> as my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> hath.

Therefore take <S%H3947><s%> unto you now <S%H6258><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> bullocks <S%H6499><s%> and seven <S%H7651><s%> rams, <S%H352><s%> and go <S%H1980><s%> to <S%H413><s%> my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job, <S%H347><s%> and offer up <S%H5927><s%> for <S%H1157><s%> yourselves a burnt offering; <S%H5930><s%> and my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> shall pray <S%H6419><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> you: for <S%H3588><s%> <S%H518><s%> him <S%H6440><s%> will I accept: <S%H5375><s%> lest <S%H1115><s%> I deal <S%H6213><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> you after your folly, <S%H5039><s%> in that <S%H3588><s%> ye have not <S%H3808><s%> spoken <S%H1696><s%> of <S%H413><s%> me the thing which is right, <S%H3559><s%> like my servant <S%H5650><s%> Job. <S%H347><s%>

So Eliphaz <S%H464><s%> the Temanite <S%H8489><s%> and Bildad <S%H1085><s%> the Shuhite <S%H7747><s%> and Zophar <S%H6691><s%> the Naamathite <S%H5284><s%> went, <S%H1980><s%> and did <S%H6213><s%> according as <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> commanded <S%H1696><s%> <S%H413><s%> them: the LORD <S%H3068><s%> also accepted <S%H5375><s%> <S%H6440><s%> <S%H853><s%> Job. <S%H347><s%>

And the LORD <S%H3068><s%> turned <S%H7725><s%> <S%H853><s%> the captivity <S%H7622><s%> of Job, <S%H347><s%> when he prayed <S%H6419><s%> for <S%H1157><s%> his friends: <S%H7453><s%> also the LORD <S%H3068><s%> gave <S%H3254><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> <S%H853><s%> twice <S%H4932><s%> as much as he had before. <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%>

Then came <S%H935><s%> there unto <S%H413><s%> him all <S%H3605><s%> his brethren, <S%H251><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> his sisters, <S%H269><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> they that had been of his acquaintance <S%H3045><s%> before, <S%H6440><s%> and did eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> him in his house: <S%H1004><s%> and they bemoaned <S%H5110><s%> him, and comforted <S%H5162><s%> him over <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> that <S%H834><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> had brought <S%H935><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> him: every man <S%H376><s%> also gave <S%H5414><s%> him a piece of money, <S%H7192><s%> <S%H259><s%> and every one <S%H376><s%> an <S%H259><s%> earring <S%H5141><s%> of gold. <S%H2091><s%>

So the LORD <S%H3068><s%> blessed <S%H1288><s%> <S%H853><s%> the latter end <S%H319><s%> of Job <S%H347><s%> more than his beginning: <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7225><s%> for he had <S%H1961><s%> fourteen <S%H702><s%> <S%H6240><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> sheep, <S%H6629><s%> and six <S%H8337><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> camels, <S%H1581><s%> and a thousand <S%H505><s%> yoke <S%H6776><s%> of oxen, <S%H1241><s%> and a thousand <S%H505><s%> she asses. <S%H860><s%>
He had <S%H1961><s%> also seven <S%H7658><s%> sons <S%H1121><s%> and three <S%H7969><s%> daughters. <S%H1323><s%>

And he called <S%H7121><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of the first, <S%H259><s%> Jemima; <S%H3224><s%> and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the second, <S%H8145><s%> Kezia; <S%H7103><s%> and the name <S%H8034><s%> of the third, <S%H7992><s%> Keren-happuch. <S%H7163><s%>

And in all <S%H3605><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> were no <S%H3808><s%> women <S%H802><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> so fair <S%H3303><s%> as the daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Job: <S%H347><s%> and their father <S%H1><s%> gave <S%H5414><s%> them inheritance <S%H5159><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> their brethren. <S%H251><s%>

After <S%H310><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> lived <S%H2421><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> a hundred <S%H3967><s%> and forty <S%H705><s%> years, <S%H8141><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> his sons, <S%H1121><s%> and <S%H853><s%> his sons' <S%H1121><s%> sons, <S%H1121><s%> even four <S%H702><s%> generations. <S%H1755><s%>
So Job <S%H347><s%> died, <S%H4191><s%> being old <S%H2205><s%> and full <S%H7649><s%> of days. <S%H3117><s%>
